be.docarch.odt2braille
Class PEF

java.lang.Object
  be.docarch.odt2braille.PEF
All Implemented Interfaces:
org.xml.sax.ErrorHandler
public class PEF
extends java.lang.Object
implements org.xml.sax.ErrorHandler

This class provides a way to convert a flat .odt file to a .pef (portable embosser format) file. The conversion is done according to previously defined braille Settings. liblouisxml is used for the actual transcription to braille. A Checker checks the resulting braille document for possible accessibility issues.

Author:
Bert Frees
See Also:
liblouisxml

PEF

           javax.xml.transform.TransformerException,
           java.lang.InterruptedException,
           LiblouisXMLException
Creates a new PEF instance. The Locale for the user interface is set to the default value.

Parameters:
flatOdtFile - The "flat XML" .odt file. This single file is the concatenation of all XML files in a normal .odt file.
liblouisDirUrl - The URL of the liblouis executable.
settings - The Settings that determine how the conversion is done.
statusIndicator - The StatusIndicator that will be used.
checker - The Checker that will check the braille document for possible accessibility issues.
odtLocale - The Locale for the document.

Method Detail

makePEF

public boolean makePEF()
                throws java.io.IOException,
                       javax.xml.parsers.ParserConfigurationException,
                       javax.xml.transform.TransformerConfigurationException,
                       javax.xml.transform.TransformerException,
                       java.lang.InterruptedException,
                       org.xml.sax.SAXException,
                       ValidationException,
                       LiblouisXMLException
Converts the flat .odt filt to a .pef file according to the braille settings. This function
  • uses OdtTransformer to convert the .odt file to multiple DAISY-like xml files,
  • uses LiblouisXML to translate these files into braille, and
  • recombines these braille files into one single .pef file.
First, the document body is processed and split in volumes, then the page ranges are calculated and finally the preliminary pages of each volume are processed and inserted at the right places. The checker checks the DAISY-like files and the volume lengths.

Throws:
java.io.IOException
javax.xml.parsers.ParserConfigurationException
javax.xml.transform.TransformerConfigurationException
javax.xml.transform.TransformerException
java.lang.InterruptedException
org.xml.sax.SAXException
ValidationException
LiblouisXMLException
